intro: Perityle nuda, commonly known as the naked perityle, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized flora species.
